Air Commuters: With wings, humans could travel by air like birds, reducing travel time and eliminating traffic jams. Confidence Score: 0.8

Sky Skyscrapers: Taller buildings could be constructed, as humans could easily reach the upper floors without elevators. This could lead to new architectural designs and city skylines. Confidence Score: 0.9
Aerial Agriculture: Wings would enable humans to tend to crops and harvest them more efficiently, leading to increased food production and reduced carbon footprint. Confidence Score: 0.8
Vertical Cities: Cities could be built vertically, with residential, commercial, and industrial areas all stacked on top of each other, maximizing space and reducing land use. Confidence Score: 0.9
Airborne Sports: New sports and recreational activities could emerge, such as aerial basketball, sky surfing, and wing-based extreme sports. Confidence Score: 0.7
